events.description: The dam builders are threatening to go on strike if their working conditions are not improved.
events.decision1Desc: The dam builders happily got back to work after a feast on the royal cheese supplies.
events.decision2Desc: The ring leaders were executed and the dam builders quickly got back to their craft.

decision2.description: Send the army in to make an example of the troublemakers.

events.description: There is an outbreak of deadly rat flu in the capital.
events.decision1Desc: At a price, the dog healers saved the city from the worst of the flu.

decision1.description: Pay foreign dogctors to treat the population.

events.decision2Desc: There was an exodus from the capital leaving it without workers to tend to the economy.

decision2.description: Round up and execute any rat that sneezes.

events.description: The price of cheese has skyrocketed as the humans have stopped littering.
events.decision1Desc: The rats rejoicing in your name.

decision1.description: Open your private collection to the needy.

events.decision2Desc: Food riots in the capital led to a reduction in the population and lowered the demand for food.

decision2.description: Tax the cheese, the population was getting out of control anyway.

events.description: Arrange a wedding with the rich princess of the lands foreign.
events.decision1Desc: Your subjects disapprove but your coffers overflow.

decision1.description: Let us share love and land!

events.decision2Desc: Your people rejoice at your commitment to the empire.

decision2.description: I would never abandon my rats!

events.description: Open the borders to the merchants of the cat and dog trade caravans.
events.decision1Desc: Your military becomes overwhelmed by the influx of outsiders but the empire prospers.

decision1.description: Let gold flow into the empire!

events.decision2Desc: Your generals approve but at the price of growing your coffers.

decision2.description: I would not take their tacky wares in 1000 years!
